thread.title: ASU vs. Utah: What to watch for
thread.title_full: ASU vs. Utah: What to watch for

title: ASU vs. Utah: What to watch for
text:
ASU vs. Utah: What to watch for Can the Sun Devils pull off another huge road upset? Post to Facebook ASU vs. Utah: What to watch for Can the Sun Devils pull off another huge road upset?   12news.com: http://12ne.ws/1RMnMJk   Join the Conversation To   ASU vs. Utah: What to watch for Robby Baker , 12 Sports 6:50 a.m. MST October 16, 2015 Robby Baker previews the ASU vs. Utah matchup. KPNX Can the Sun Devils pull off another huge road upset? Oct 10, 2015; Tempe, AZ, USA; Arizona State Sun Devils wide receiver D.J. Foster (8) celebrates a touchdown catch against the Colorado Buffaloes during the second half at Sun Devil Stadium. The Sun Devils won 48-23. Mandatory Credit: Joe Camporeale-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Joe Camporeale-USA TODAY Sports) 
Can ASU make program history? 
The Arizona State Sun Devils are 0-9 all-time against top five opponents on the road. 
The Utah Utes are ranked fourth right now and host ASU this Saturday. 
But this is why they play the games. 
MORE ASU: What goes into an ASU football road trip? 
Everybody counted ASU out against UCLA a few weeks ago, and yet the Sun Devils pulled off the big upset and turned their season around. 
Things won't be easy for ASU in Salt Lake City, but if they can play a full 60 minutes don't count Todd Graham's squad out. 
It's also worth mentioning that ASU if 4-0 against Utah since the Utes joined the Pac-12. 
Anatomy of an upset 
Against UCLA, the Sun Devils had less penalty yards, more first downs, more total yards and dominated in time of possession. 
That's how they pulled off the big, road upset. 
MORE COLLEGE FOOTBALL: USC and South Carolina open, what about Rich Rod and Graham? 
If ASU wants to beat the Utes, they will need to win all those stat categories again. 
Specifically, they need to make sure they win the third down battle. They need to get defensive stops and keep their own drives going. 
Against USC, the Sun Devil defense couldn't get off the field. The Bruins, however, were only 3-14 on third downs. 
It was a major difference in the game. ASU Football biggest game yet KPNX 
The last two years, these games have been very close, with last season's affair going to overtime. 
Saturday's matchup will likely be a battle to the end. 
Whatever team avoids making the big mistake will be victorious. 
Stop Devontae Booker, force Travis Wilson to beat you 
If you're ASU, you want to make Travis Wilson beat you. 
The Utah QB has thrown for five touchdowns and three interceptions this season. His numbers don't fly off the page. 
Now running back Devontae Booker is a different story completely. 
He's already rushed for 665 yards this season and six TDs. 
He leads the Pac-12 in yards after contact and could be a difference maker this Saturday. The game plan for ASU should be very, very similar to how they attacked UCLA. 
The Sun Devils stopped Paul Perkins and forced UCLA to get away from their game. 
If ASU can do the same against Utah, ASU fans will be singing the fight song late Saturday night. Read or Share this story: http://12ne.ws/1RMnMJk TOP VIDEOS
